title: Free (GPL like), legal font license required
content:
I want to publish a typeface I'm working on (which I hope will form part of a small family) and need to include a license. I've been trying to find an appropriate free license, along the lines of the GPL/copyleft which might cover any nasties/abuses happening later.

I'm aware that there are issues with GPL licenses in fonts. (See here: [http://www.typophile.com/node/31738](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164046/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31738 "http://www.typophile.com/node/31738")) So it needn't be a GPL license. I just can't find an appropriate, simple license text specific to font distribution.

Essentially it needs to cover my free distribution, future free distribution (license intact) and my copyright.

Anyone with a similar license they use?
author: olho

comments.content: There's the [Freetype license](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164046/http:/freetype.sourceforge.net/FTL.TXT) and the [SIL Open Font license.](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164046/http:/scripts.sil.org/cms/scripts/page.php?site_id=nrsi&id=OFL)

\* The [FreeType license](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164046/http:/freetype.sourceforge.net/FTL.TXT) was designed as a license for the [FreeType](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164046/http:/www.freetype.org/) rendering engine (a software library) not as a license for fonts.

\* Recently [Bruce Perens](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164046/http:/perens.com/about/introduction/) in his blog article [Warning: SIL Open Font License](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164046/http:/perens.com/blog/2009/02/17/64/) has expressed some concern about SIL's [Open Font License](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164046/http:/scripts.sil.org/OFL) claiming: _"There appears to be an unintended loophole that would allow the conversion of any font under the license to public domain."_

\* There is a " [Font Exception](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164046/http:/www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-faq.html#FontException)" which can be tagged onto the end of the [GPL](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164046/http:/www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html) to make it suitable for fonts ~ however the author of that subsequently wrote an article on [Font Licensing and the GPL](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164046/http:/www.fsf.org/blogs/licensing/20050425novalis) in which he expressed some reservations.

- Chris

Good Luck. I have been looking for the same thing with no success.

[http://www.typophile.com/node/55841](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164046/http:/www.typophile.com/node/55841)

I'll be watching to see what you come up with.
